description: From Middle French pubescent, from Latin pubescens (“to become hairy, downy, or an adult”).

adjectives.description: pubescent (comparative more pubescent, superlative most pubescent)

entries.meaning: At or just after the age of puberty.
examples: […]  the pubescent male brain isn't noted for its consistent engagement with reality […]

entries.meaning: (botany, zoology) Covered with down or fine hairs.
An individual who is going through puberty.
